intro: Comanthera reflexa, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Comanthera reflexa is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap.
